text: My favorite place in London. OMG One weekend, I've been twice there... Love the UBE ICE CREAM üòç
The guyabano ice cream (no dairy though, great for vegan or lactose intolerant folks) teleports me to my childhood. It‚Äôs so good and fresh  :,)

As a Filipino I am a little biased so not sure I can give 5stars but this place is great, vibe reminds me of home, the staff are friendly and helpful. The food... well, their Halo halo is one of the best I've had and I've had many in ‚Ä¶
Unique flavours from the Philippines and other Filipino deserts such as ube brownie, buko pie and halo-halo. Excellent service and a clean environment.
Great desserts, the ube shake was really good.
Amazing place to try unique ice cream. The calamansi juice is sooooo refreshing. Even in the middle of winter!

A Filipino ice cream/dessert place in Chinatown. This is like my comfy place in London where I get to eat my favorites

I arrived the second they opened, dying to eat their famous burnt coconut icecream. They hadn't finished making it so I patiently waited and in return for my loyalty they offered it to me in the house! So that was crazy sweet.  Plus now I'm obsessed with this ice cream, it was incredibly delicious!!
Tasty snack, I'll be back for the Milo I've cream.
The Binong are great

Go here for the UBE ice cream in the milk bun. So good I had 2 in one day and will be returning later today for another :D 
Oh and weekend donuts!

AMAZING authentic Filipino dishes/desserts
Cannot recommend this place enough
Small and cozy, with affordable prices
Busy but delicious and worth the wait!

Overall great ice cream, with their speciality flavors being purple ube and black coconut. The taste is very good but definitely pricey. ¬£4.5 for two modestly sized scoops. Seating is plentiful but cramped and the shop can get very crowded. Worth a slight detour if you're in the area already.
Lovely dessert
The milk bun was a bit sweet and doughy. Ube ice cream great though.

Aesthetic is amazing and wow their Bilog was great and the Ube ice cream is so great (first time I‚Äôve ever tried either)

So yummy! The Ube ice cream cake was really nice. It was really busy though and barely enough seats but I think that it was worth it! A bit pricey.. especially for what it is. But it‚Äôs got a really cool vibe about it so it‚Äôs a fun place to go!
Love Mamasons, they really know how to utilize Ube and I would highly recommend the Bilog as a lovely post dinner treat.
The bilog is worth a try!
Yummy donuts and milshakes!!

Amazingggg desserts, especially if you‚Äôre a lover of ube like me! Each dessert was ¬£6.50, the halo halo was good, very filling good for sharing. ube brioche bun was good too! A must try in China town :)

It's a nice ice cream especially the Ube 
Ube ice cream is a must try flavour of ice cream they also have Ube bilog which is their best seller i recommend it to anyone who was looking for good dessert place.
Lovely selection of ice cream to choose from
I had the bilog with chocolate ice cream. I definitely recommend it.
Very delicious halo halo
Loved it! The ube bilog is amazing

Very busy and it seemed like only half the staff were doing anything so it was very slow. The flavours aren‚Äôt really my thing so it was quite sickly, really more an Instagram opportunity than a desert I would rush back for
Great
best Filipino ice cream especially if you wanna try ube! halo-halo is a must try!
The ice cream was outstanding! I had the purple potato and charcoal coconut. Both delicious!
Got the halo halo and the ice cream bun, was good.  Although we couldn't finish the halo halo fast enough so the ice melted and watered it down.
Nice selection of deserts. Enjoyed the tart the most. If you are a Matcha fan, then a must go place.
Magical ice cream. It was great to try something from the Philippines, something not as commonly found as your normal ice cream scoop. The staff was awesome and the shop is so cute!
Good, but a bit overpriced for its own version of halo-halo.
Amazing dessert place. Would recommend the ice creams

You can find authentic Filipino desserts here, you can find it a little bit pricey but it‚Äôs all worth it. The Ube and Queso Ice cream was the best with also the Bilog which is ube ice cream inside a warm pandesal bun.
Feels like home. They serve the best Philippine ice cream in London :D They have Bilog and HaloHalo.

Very busy,Orders being taken but the preparation of the orders not keeping up

Nice vibe, milo ice cream with a milk bun was nice. A bit too sweet for my liking, seating is a bit tough. I'd say priced 50% higher than real value, good nevertheless.
